prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: PKS1138 dust continuum observation with Band-7
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: A project to obtain a spatially resolved dusty star formation wihtin (U)LIRGs in PKS1138 proto-cluster at z=2.2

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We will take 14 pointings with Band-7 (345GHz) to detect dust continuum emission from z~2 galaxies. We exploit "C34-7" configuration (allowing 0.12" resolution), which is comparable to the existing HST data. The Band-7 is the best choice for our purpose because it covers near the peak of the SEDs of z~2 galaxies. We estimate flux density at Band-7 of individual sources using the MIPS/24um photometry. The 24um fluxes are first converted to the total IR luminosity L(IR) assuming the template SEDs of starburst galaxies of Lagache et al. (2004), and then they are transformed to SFRs (using the Kennicutt 1998 calibration). As shown in Table 1, all the sources have SFR>~100Msun/yr (equivalently, log(L(IR))>~11.8). We estimated the 345GHz (850um) continuum flux density using the same model galaxies, and we also listed them in Table 1 in SJ. Based on the official ALMA sensitivity calculator, we can reach to limiting flux density of 1sigma=0.070 mJy with 8.4 min on-source integration with full bandwidth (=7.5 GHz) in Band-7. With this exposure time, we will be able to detect all the sources with >5sigma significance, and more significant detection (>15sigma) is expected for bright sources, allowing a morphological study as well as the study of each clump property (see the observing simulation with CASA in Fig.~3 in SJ). For fainter sources, detection might be challenging, particularly if their star-forming regions are widely extended. We still expect that the detection is not very hard because they are expected to be compact, nucleated starbursts under environmental effects (see SJ). We also note that there remains a large uncertainty in estimating the total IR luminosity from single rest-frame 8um photometry, but with the proposed observing time wec an detect most sources even if we consider conservatively 50% uncertainty in L(IR). In summary, to complete all the 14 pointings, we request 4.5 hours in total, including overhead and calibration.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose ALMA/Band-7 (850-micron) dust continuum observations of Halpha-selected, massive (ULIRG-class) star-forming galaxies selected in a rich proto-cluster environment at z=2.16. With the "C34-7" configuration (allowing the highest spatial resolution of 0.12"), we aim to spatially resolve their dust-enshrouded star-forming regions down to ~1-kpc scale. Our goals are: (1) We will determine if the young cluster galaxies are forming stars in a compact (nucleated) region, or if their SF activity is extended over the disk. (2) By comparing the sub-millimeter morphologies with the existing rest-frame UV morphologies obtained with ACS/HST data, we will identify where the most intense dusty starbursts (hence rapid stellar build-up) are taking place within the young cluster galaxies. (3) By comparing their sub-millimeter morphologies as well as the nature of internal clumps with those of identically selected general field galaxies (which will be obtained through our successful ALMA Cycle-1 programme), we will infer which physical processes trigger (and finally truncate) SF activities of galaxies in high-density environment z>2.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
